description:
FlashForge's FlashPrint advertised linux support for their slicer, but it's severely lacking. Only a .deb is provided. And while the program runs, it's almost useless.  And the reason is stupid:  The UI doesn't show up. you can dig into the manual and find the keyboard shortcuts, but without the UI there's no way to scale objects exactly 90%.  And there's no way to enter "support mode" so you can't add any supports. 

A crippled program for the stupidest of reasons.

I used yo use this application under older ubuntu vertions and was working fine (I am not comparing vs more sofisticated software like slic3r). I migrate to Debian 10 and tried to install again and software become useless.
Don't have problems with this application. Can print the stuff that I want. Same functionality like Windows.
ist für Ubuntu 18.04 ungeeignet (siehe vielfältige Posts mit Ihren Problemen im Internet)
